title: How was life before the invention of book? - Quora

response.answer_text: You could’ve explained a bit more about what you actually wanted to know. But anyway.. Books, as we see them now, weren’t the same for the people in the prehistoric times. People used to inscribe on walls or carve out on rocks or woods or other materials, just to keep a record. Now, this takes us back to the time when inscribe-able characters were first introduced to humanity, by some really smart species of our kind. People then observed that they could express with those characters to someone who was unknown to them and that laid down the roots for the first phase of communication between us, the humans. Many years later when someone started to combine these characters and formed words, then phrases, then sentences, languages were born. Now, when people knew about a language, some of them tried to express themselves using it, like what we do even today. They started writing, but they weren’t the first ones. Philosophers were then born. If you look out for “the world’s oldest books” on the internet right now, you can see a lot of books that just tell you something about the religions or believes. This gives us a vague idea about their lifestyle. Also, the earliest books which were introduced, were only found to be written on woods or leaves of the trees or even on the skin of dead animals. After all this, now that you know that books are so old that life before them would just have been fighting, hunting, cooking, farming, sending smoke signals, raising kids and protecting.
